website_summaries.verdict: A great mechanical keyboard that has many customizable features that gamers and non-gamers alike will appreciate.
pros: This mechanical keyboard includes a wrist rest and audio-out/mic-in jacks
The backlight colors can be customized for each key and 5 keys are available that can be programmed as macros
Comfortable to use and lasts a long time
cons: The software that you have to use to customize the backlight is hard to use and the keys are fairly loud even for a mechanical keyboard

customer_reviews.title: 2 defective units - poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received had the now notorious problem of repeating keys. You press h, and h repeats until you tap on it a few times. This happens with multiple keys. Not a cleaning issue, the tray under the keys was immaculate. Nothing was ever spilled on either unit. You will see online that loading new firmware might fix the problem, it did not for me. Tested on multiple PC's with the same problem. Razer would not replace the second unit due to being a few days past warranty. Not only will I never buy another Razer product, I will never pay for another premium gaming keyboard. Enjoy your $200 Razer.
customer_reviews.author: William B. Bertram

customer_reviews.title: this piece of garbage broke down after 4 months of use it cost ...
customer_reviews.text: this piece of garbage broke down after 4 months of use it cost over 100 dollar for gods sake id have 25 dollar logtiech keyboards last longer now i have to pay like for the facking shipping box to send piece of garbage back
customer_reviews.author: Adamm

customer_reviews.title: Carefull which mouse you buy to use with this keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: If you try to buy the whole razer kit; to Chroma sincronize it, be carefull which products you buy since not all chroma mouses are compatible with this Keyboard. FOR EXAMPLE: I have the Razer Deathadder Elite and I cant synchronize the lights of the mouse with the lights of the keyboard. Look for the Razer Synapse 3 compatible devices, if you want to know which devices can be used with this Keyboard. PERFORMANCE WISE: It is amazing. That is all you need to know. AMAZING. If you want to treat yourself go for this Keyboard. But I cant use my keyboard with my razer mouse since they are not from the same generation.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Definetley not Silent
customer_reviews.text: I like this keyboard especially with the wrist pad. In regards to being Orange Clickers and (Quiet) I wouldn't exactly call them Silent if you are typing fast. Now they def don't have that clicking noise like the other Switches have. I do like the USB connectivity spots on the right side of the keyboard, but you would think they might be able to have the power cord be able to move from the right or left side for preference purposes instead of directly out of the front and center. All in all a great keyboard. I have my keyboard set to a white with the WASDF Shift and Space bar glowing red. Pretty simply.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Ashworth

customer_reviews.title: After almost a month, my fingers are in heaven!
customer_reviews.text: First keyboard that was shipped to me was dead on arrival. Called Razer customer service to confirm and directed me to handle the return through Amazon. A completely effortless experience using their online chat and 2 days later, I had a replacement. Loving the RGB and the mechanical yellows. Noticeably quieter than my previous Cherry MX Reds. The only bad thing about the product has nothing to do with product. It's the software. Sometimes it doesn't boot correctly and I'll have different colors or different settings on display. A simple opening of the Razer Synapse fixes that but honestly, this keyboard costs too much to have that kind of problem. Still love it though.
customer_reviews.author: chazkez

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control.
customer_reviews.text: So it is comfortable to use. The RGB lighting is very nice and fun to customize. Even without the wrist rest it is quite comfortable. My only issue with this is the logo. I think it is a big part of the keyboard and it looks like they doped the ball on quality control. The defect is an eyesore. An expensive keyboard but with little quality control. Therefore I will have to give it a low rating. Update: Got a replacement. Logo looks clean but wouldn't you know the keyboard wobbles.
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro Lopez

customer_reviews.title: It feels good to have a Blackwidow again.
customer_reviews.text: AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH I LOVE IT!!!!!!!. The Yellow Razer switches really help with the streaming. I had a blackwidow before because the MX cherry Blue switched it had (yes MX Cherry switches) were too loud for a recording/stream so I had to switch to a Razer Ornata. But I still wasn't satisfied. I missed the feel of a mechanical keyboard. When I found out that Razer was developing their own switches And there were 3 different types, I had to get the yellows. They're so fun. There's a bit of a slight learning curve after using a different keyboard for a long while. But after a few hours of typing, it becomes like second nature.
customer_reviews.author: Briegal Nightwalker

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Had this keyboard for 2 years and I love it. Got the orange switches since my last keyboard had cherry mx blue and I felt those were too loud. The orange feel and sound exactly like cherry mx brown. Some colors are not as bright as others. The fact that with some games the colors automatically change was a big surprise and a huge bonus. The ability to change the colors in the razer menu was nice and easy. Will definitely continue buying keyboards from razer.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: ... switches definitely feel different and not necessarily in a good way, but not on a bad way either
customer_reviews.text: The razer switches definitely feel different and not necessarily in a good way, but not on a bad way either. Lighting works as advertised although the program could use some usability tweaks. It also took me a while to get used to the extra buttons on the left side of the letter keys. They kind of mess up your natural instinct of placing your hands on the edge of the keyboard where you know the letters should be. Very nice keyboard though. Bonus: includes an adorable key cap keychain that lights up when you press it down.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: You should definitely buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely head over heels! -It's pretty, there is a lot of customization that can be done with the lighting. -The wrist support is incredible - I have a corner desk and there is not a lot of room for a keyboard. The wrist rest is a soft, smooth padding on a solid plastic base and I use it to span the blank space in the corner, giving me a little more room to work with. -And then, the keys... beautiful, comfortable, responsive, clicky keys. They make my heart happy. If you're using this for excessive, writing-a-book typing, I suppose the noise could be annoying, but for gaming and general use they are fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: TypeOneDerful

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 years but...
customer_reviews.text: I liked this keyboard a lot but a little after 2 years of use it started spamming the 1 key making it usable. Eventually the 1 key stopped working entirely but would still spam occasionally, a couple other keys spammed at times too. Luckily I the warranty so I shipped it back and got a replacement. I upgraded to the newer Blackwidow Elite model for free I just paid price of the warranty since that came in handy last time. I would definitely recommend the warranty with Razer products.
customer_reviews.author: C-Dude Zombiekiller

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, great quality
customer_reviews.text: Cannot tell you how excited my daughter was to be getting her first Razer keyboard. Packaging was great (except for a few key caps that managed to fall loose...?) but we ended up just pushing them back into place. She had a hard time deciding over Corsair or Razer, but this keyboard was definitely worth the money. The wrist wrest is very soft and cushioned, but defiantly raises her hands a bit to over the keys, putting her hands in an awkward position. The chroma lighting effects are absolutely beautiful. Overall, this is a pretty great keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Sungmi Choi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing effects. Good keyboard. Okay price
customer_reviews.text: RGB effects looks amazing. Chroma software is okay. I really like the magnetic wristrest. Do not like the mechanical switch clones but it is not bad. A tad bit pricey though considering the switches are clones and don't feel as crisp as cherry.
customer_reviews.author: S01-X

customer_reviews.title: Razer Keyboards Rock!
customer_reviews.text: I’m definitely a little biased. I’ve always loved Razer products and the chroma line is my absolute favorite. The keyboard works incredibly well. The keys are soft and quiet but just the right amount of clacky to be satisfying. The lighting is gorgeous and customizable and has a lot of different awesome presets. I bought this particular one for my boyfriend and have it on the fire setting and it’s so cool. Highly recommend this keyboard if you want the quality of a mechanical keyboard without too much noise and the fun lighting.
customer_reviews.author: Darrian Grassi

customer_reviews.title: Color customization options otherwise are pretty cool. The keys are 'quiet' compared to some ...
customer_reviews.text: Really big. Did I say big? Yes, BIG. Indicators for caps lock, game mode, etc. don't always work as expected with Mac or Windows 10. Can't customize caps lock key to toggle color, so the indicator is in the top-right corner for some reason. Color customization options otherwise are pretty cool. The keys are 'quiet' compared to some mechanical keyboards, but don't be expecting anything comparable to a chiclet-keyboard. Mouse/peripheral pass through only works if you plug in a second pass through USB cable from the keyboard, so it only really helps if your mouse has a really short cord. Overall a pretty neat keyboard, despite some flaws.
customer_reviews.author: observer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I didn't like how it felt. Felt too big and bulky. Also wasn't very clicky and felt basic. One spill and my keyboard was done for. I'd suggest getting something cheaper and better. Aukey has some really good keyboards for low prices.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Zdinak

customer_reviews.title: Loving it! Awesome for Overwatch too!
customer_reviews.text: So far, after a few months, I am loving this key board! The mechanical keyboards are something I had to get a little used to but I am loving the use of Macros as well! No more typing out email addresses, street addresses, passwords, usernames, ever again! Plus, if you are a big Overwatch player like I am, it has an AWESOMEEE lighting profile that comes with it by default. I would highly recommend sticking to it! For example, if you're playing Lucio, it will switch from a Green Color - Wave effect to Yellow Wave effect when you switch from Speed Boost to Healing! Mercy has a similar effect with her character as well! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Chad Holmes

customer_reviews.title: The keyboard for both office and gaming!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing quality keyboard by Razer. This keyboard is chroma enabled and able to be customized via the Synapse software included for free. This will permit you to customize color based on the games you're playing or programs you're utilizing on your computer. The wrist pad is soft, and quite comfortable. The keys are cherry green switches and feel amazing to type on. The cord is high quality nit fiber wrapped and feels solid.
customer_reviews.author: M3dd1e

customer_reviews.title: Finally! Yeah buddy!
customer_reviews.text: After my dog accidentally spilled my coffee all over my last razer keyboard, I’ve been dying to buy this one. And it does not disappoint. I missed the clicky sound/feel. All the different light configurations are so cool. I haven’t set up any macros yet but will return after I’ve done so to update my review. Yes it’s a pricey keyboard but if you’re a serious gamer or you just like a b*tchin looking keyboard, this is the one for you! (Fire light config in video) Looks cooler than the video but you get the idea.
customer_reviews.author: Orchid

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but not easy to start with
customer_reviews.text: I just wish that the shift function on the keys was also lit by the RGB and not just printed on. I play in the dark for screen glare reasons (window behind me reflects lights straight onto my screen) and not having all those lit up when my old keyboard on my laptop did have them all lit is disappointing. It's already hard enough going from a laptop keyboard to a desktop keyboard that is longer than the laptop itself but to only have the main functions backlit after miskeying and trying to find where you are is just pain.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: A great keyboard for gaming or business
customer_reviews.text: I liked this keyboard so much I have bought two over the last two years. Both were refurbished. I do recommend installing the key O's that cushion the key action. It is just more comfortable on the fingers. Your preferences are stored online so the keyboard can be moved and still have the same configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Skelplevel

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed, price is high quality is low
customer_reviews.text: Defective. Came with two Q's on the keyboard missing the O. Very disappointed, price is high quality is low.
customer_reviews.author: Hc

customer_reviews.title: Honestly my favorite keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard feels great to type on. Not only that but the RGB control software is easy to use and comes with plenty of excellent presets. If that wasn't enough, the keyboard also comes with an insanely comfortable wrist rest. If you had the previous chroma this will feel like an upgrade and I'm glad they removed the gamer-like font on the keycaps and went with a more professional look. Honestly, this is my favorite keyboard of all time and I enjoyed typing my review using it.
customer_reviews.author: basket

customer_reviews.title: Solid built, dedicated macro keys, but BIG wrist rest gets in the way.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a keyboard to replace my old G15. I tried this one and the Corsair K70. I don't need RGB, I just want a nice mech keyboard with macros. While the software on this one is good, the only real complain I have (and why I'm sending it back) is that the wrist rest is too big. You have to really reach out to type. The keys also felt too close together. There are no dedicated media controls either. It's a solid keyboard, but I'm going to go back to my K70 and return this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: Full customization, with profiles that can be set to specific applications so the hot buttons, lighting, function keys, etc. can all be set according to the situation, or you can switch between profiles manually if you just want to mix up the lighting, or you have more macros/shortcuts that you want to apply to the keys. You could conceivably have dozens of shortcuts saved, and just switch between profiles with two button presses to access them. You'd just ave to memorize dozens of button configurations.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Moren

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is awesome. I wanted the razor product because I have the mouse to go with it. I matched the colours with the keyboard and the mouce. Now! The USB and the headphones jack that plug into the keyboard, that means the keyboard has 2 USB plugs to plug in and a headphone jack to plug into the computer. Keep that in mind. Keyboard is nice weight and stays in place even with me pushing a little. Same with the wrist cushion, they are 2 separate pieces. Check out the picture! And it comes with a little sample button that glows all the colours. I don't know if you can change the battery in it though.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: so this was a great opportunity to purchase a new one for gaming
customer_reviews.text: The "G" key on my former keyboard (don't ask) died, so this was a great opportunity to purchase a new one for gaming. I had heard great things about (tactile) mechanical keyboards but was worried about it being too loud so that others would hear it over my headset. I picked the orange switches and they're perfect! I also own the Razer Deathadder Chroma mouse so it's especially slick that I can sync the color patterns/changes across my peripherals.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Wu

customer_reviews.title: The best purchased I've made in a long time... and I buy a lot of stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I almost never write a review. Ever. But I just had to with this keyboard. I type extremely fast and find it difficult on standard keyboards to hit all the keys properly. When I switched to a mechanical keyboard, it made a big difference. And now that I switched to the Razer with the yellow switches.... my goodness... every keystroke is swift like a ninja. This is the best keyboard I've ever used and I don't foresee any other options taking it's place. Bravo Razer... seriously. Bra-f'ing-vo!
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Had to return - This is not silent
customer_reviews.text: Within the first 10 seconds of using this I knew it was a return. It is not as loud as their green, true. The fact that Razer calls this keyboard "silent" seriously makes me question the company. The keys don't click, but every press makes noise of key hitting bottom and its loud. If you need a silent keyboard, this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: Jreview

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: My most tried and true Keyboards have always been BlackWidows. The new yellow switches are the best yet from Razer. The Linear Silent feature they provide feels fantastic, and I've stopped getting complaints about the keyboard when I'm on mic. The inclusion of the wrist rest is great. It's magnetic, so it's easy to remove when not in use but holds together through my most vicious play sessions. I'm not sure if Razer sells replacement wrist rests but that would be great.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Walen

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: The Razer Greens are a great switch (mimic of Cherry Blues). The RGB on this thing is absolutely incredible if you want under shine (if you are looking for a classier look that justs highlights the character on the key go with Logitech). The build quality on this thing is superb as well. I have spilt drinks on it and it has had no problems with it. I have also pounded the shit out of it and it is still running perfectly over a year later. This keyboard is incredible and is by far the best full-sized keyboard I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: McCready

customer_reviews.title: Great Gaming Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: My favorite gaming keyboard to date! I especially like that you can make the individual keys different colors. It makes it easier to group keys by action. ASWD are one color, attacking buttons are a different color, other action keys are another, etc. If you are a gamer then this is the keyboard for you!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron G.

customer_reviews.title: but I really love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely not SILENT, but I really love this keyboard. I am still getting used to it, however I am definitely never going back to a membrane keyboard. Keys don't have much grip so my fingers can glide around pretty fast. That wrist rest is also great, and I love that the font of the keys is not in some lame mid-2005 action movie font like other major gaming keyboard brands. I am using this for video editing.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Get the product😂🔥👌🏻
customer_reviews.text: This Keyboard is outstanding. The feeling, the typing, the CONTROL, RGB. There is just so much I can say for this amazing product! But I’m going to keep this review Moderare in length😂. The software If compatible with any of your laptops or computers when plugging in with an HUD adapter. You can put the “4” main softwares on a hard-drive to transfer the data to other devices. The RGB Chroma for the keyboard is truelly amazing giving me the option to configure what every type of desine I desire :) “My favorite performed one is WAVE at 9.5 speed.👌🏻“ I definitely recommend this keyboard to anyone who wants great performance and Awsome compatibility!
customer_reviews.author: CraftyAlbatross

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this keyboard with orange switches. Razer has ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this keyboard with orange switches. Razer has blatantly lied with their description of tactile but silent. The keys are silent but there is NO tactile feedback that you would normally expect from a mechanical keyboard. TOTAL RIPOFF
customer_reviews.author: Nate Devlin

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, durable, customizable, loud.
customer_reviews.text: Loud as ever keys that everyone can hear. Plently of customizability with certain keys. Software is better than Razer's Chroma Mice. Cording is so thick it gets stuck on everything. Keyboard it self is extremely durable, dropped off of table ending in the floor getting damaged instead of the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Clark V

customer_reviews.title: Razer BlackWidow Chroma V2-RGB MECH GAMING KEYBOARD
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son he loves his games it lights all different colors and probably more that I don't even know about but it is rugged just what a gamer needs a durable keyboard is perfect for gaming will keep you updated if it fails but I doubt it it's very well made I'm very happy with my purchase & so is he that's what matters the most
customer_reviews.author: The Dragon Wind Ninja

customer_reviews.title: This Keyboard is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this keyboard for about a month now and haven't had any problems yet. The key response is amazing, the colors look amazing and vibrant and of course (since I have the green switches) the clickiness of the the keys is great on the ears. I love this keyboard and have and will recommend it to any of my friend in the future who are looking for a keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Susan L

customer_reviews.title: Razer Got Me - This Keyboard is Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Despite the large pricetag, this product is stunning. An absolutely fabulous design with a convenient, comfortable wrist wrest. I love the design of this keyboard and the many features it entails. As mentioned before, the wrist wrest is an added benefit to a stellar keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Keatley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, even if you are NOT a gamer
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why some are giving bad reviews to Razer keyboards. They are very well built with good materials and deliver solid performance. I own the one with orange switches that I do NOT use for gaming at all and I am very pleased with it. I highly recommend this keyboard as a fancy working tool and, if you are a gamer, perhaps it will also make you a happy customer like me.
customer_reviews.author: carevalo

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, little loud
customer_reviews.text: Been using Razer products ever since I truly got into gaming, and immediately fell in love. Few years later, I'm using this keyboard as my personal/gaming keyboard, and use my old BlackWidow Chroma v1 at my work for software development. Only complaint is the sound. I was tired of the clacking of the original BlackWidow, so I got a silent variation of the v2. It's definitely better sounding, while still feeling great, but is still quite noticeable, and requires some care if your roommate is sleeping
customer_reviews.author: Jakob Glass

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. I even look forward to typing stuff because its so satisfying. Just know that it takes some getting used to when coming from regular (non-gaming) keyboards because the scale is different? it feels like the keys is bunched together more closely. You do get used to it with time though. Also you cant go wrong with all the lighting options. :)
customer_reviews.author: jake munoz

customer_reviews.title: #1 gaming keyboard, light key activation may be too light for some (causing typos while typing).
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard! Very sad it seems to be discontinued and becoming hard to find. The yellow switches are very light. It’s actually a bit tough to type with this keyboard at first, the keys are so light /responsive. Perfect for precision gamers. Quiet keys, with shortest activation stroke. Great macro and lighting software too. Can customize everything. For me, there has never been a better keyboard invented still.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Kallestad

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard but did not receive all the parts
customer_reviews.text: I love the keyboard I have had no problems with it but I was kinda disappointed when it did not arrive in the razer box with all the items. All I received was the Keyboard and the message from razer saying thanks for buying our product. I didn't even get a instructions manual. But the one thing that bothered me is that I did not receive the cool keychain with the razer key that lights up. Other then thatvits an a amazing keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Carrizales

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard did not even work for 2 months, ...
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard did not even work for 2 months, I will never buy this again. Update - was able to get the keyboard exchanged with no problems. Still a little skeptical about how it will perform. My son is now using it for his gaming computer so I guess time will tell how it's performance will be. So it has been over 6 months since I gotten the replacement and it works great so I up'ed my rating. If it make's through my son's gaming for the next year I will give this product 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dredmarine

customer_reviews.title: Tried out the green switches out just to see how thy were and looks like razer has definitely stepped up their keys
customer_reviews.text: Got green switches when i ordered the yellow. Tried out the green switches out just to see how thy were and looks like razer has definitely stepped up their keys. Nice tactile and clicky switches, like they’re suppose to be. Actuation on all keys were consistent. The wrist rest is a great feature. That might be the selling point for me. All mechanical keyboards are pretty much the same unless you’re some keyboard expert. This is in line with Mx cherry blues.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Jang

customer_reviews.title: light malfunction
customer_reviews.text: At first it was amazing then about a year in the lights started malfunctioning. I tried to update it with no luck. I moved and had it in storage for a while then decided to fix it again. I re downloaded the driver once again and the lights started to work fine again. I did call customer service and they were super helpful in getting this fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Tena

customer_reviews.title: Glowy keyboarrrd~
customer_reviews.text: I don't do much gaming but I am a sucker for glowing lights and customization. First things to note is that none of the keyboard configurations are completely silent, just one is quieter than the others. It's heavier and sturdier than any keyboard I've ever owned, and the cable is the same. I love the customization options and safe to say that this is hands down my favorite keyboard and I will cherish it like a child
customer_reviews.author: MoonieSoop

customer_reviews.title: The razer keyboard is superior to the alienware AW768 keyboard in all way
customer_reviews.text: The razer keyboard is superior to the alienware AW768 keyboard in all way! The razer wrist rest offers more support and is actually included in the purchase (Alienware $20-$30 add on) Per key lighting vs Alienware's zone lighting (much cooler effects available) The Razer green key swiches are better than the AW brown switches.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard! Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is amazing and worth every penny. Been using it for over 2 years now and its still amazing and shows no sign of wear since it's super high quality. The presses make a clicky sound and they feel great! Would highly reccomend for longterm if you sont want a vheap one that breaks after half a year.
customer_reviews.author: Keren N.

customer_reviews.title: Noisy but nice.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice keyboard, but keep in mind even though I ordered the linear and silent keys, it is mechanical and still clicky and not really very silent. This is not a good keyboard for cube work, and you will probably drive your coworkers crazy. Its also very sensitive, but its great for gaming and I feel like I can type much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Jacobo

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty, it's tuff, it's a widow.
customer_reviews.text: Like that I can pair it with the other razor devices for a great gaming experience. Love the mechanical keyboard, just enough to fight back so you are not typing on a cotton field, and soft enough that it's not double tapping when you lift you finger.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Orange Keys - Love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Orange Keys. This keyboard is everything I wanted. Nice feedback when typing with audible clicks but not so overpower that they annoy other people in the room. I was initially worried that my family would complain when I typed...but they haven't even really noticed since I changed from a "silent" keyboard to this one.
customer_reviews.author: KJFother

customer_reviews.title: Works fine and all but...
customer_reviews.text: Well using it to type this review and it works fine and all but the price is pretty steep ($150 when i got it) and i'll probably never spend that much on a keyboard again. Plus the Chroma software is garbage, works sometimes and sometimes it doesn't. Not really an issue if you don't care about the lighting options though.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy miller

customer_reviews.title: An awesome Keyboard. The RGB are Great
customer_reviews.text: An awesome Keyboard. The RGB are Great. The Green Mechanical switches make you want to keep clicking the keyboard all day long. But, there is a con, Particles tend to get between the keyboard and the included arm wrist, so you should clean it periodically.
customer_reviews.author: Saeed Gozai

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard with some faults
customer_reviews.text: I've been gaming on this keyboard for roughly a month. What I've noticed; Sometimes a key entry will stick, and can only be undone by pressing said key again. Logged on today and the lighting was only on about 30% of the keyboard. Not too often, but often enough, some keys will be completely unresponsive. To fix this and the lighting issue I'll have to unplug the keyboard and plug it back in. This keyboard feels great and does its job well. It would have 5 stars if these issues weren't...well...an issue. They're not gamebreaking and I feel I'm better in my game for using it, but beware; there will be some hiccups.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard if you have the financial means!
customer_reviews.text: Not in love with the durability of these keyboards but if you have the financial means to re-order one yearly than I would recommend these keyboards. A friend introduced me to Razer as a young gamer and I do my best to stay in the family of products!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Like New - Literally
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used (like new) because it was almost half the price of a new one, and let me say that it barely looks like anyone touched it. There's no scratches, no marks or dents on this keyboard or the wrist pad. I just took a wipe to clean up some dirty spots, but in all honesty, I'm amazed at how well in condition it is. Everything seems to be working perfectly. Super impressed and thrilled with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Callie Maxim

customer_reviews.title: Awsome RGB
customer_reviews.text: Really, REALLY awesome RGB on this keyboard. Only complaint is that the secondary key uses like " #,$,)" ect are not backlit and are the only keys I might forget where they are. Key response is great, it is a little loud but i kinda like it even though the family isn't pleased. So 4 stars, really wish I could give it 5.
customer_reviews.author: Neaxz

customer_reviews.title: So far great! I love the quality of the material used ...
customer_reviews.text: So far great! I love the quality of the material used to build the keyboard. I bought the Cynosa first due it being cheaper and it came with a manufacturing defect where the E and R keys would hit at the same time. I sent it back and got this instead. So far I love it. I give the Cynosa a 1 and this a strong 5. Synapse is still a mess though. So good luck with that no matter what product you buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Spitzer

customer_reviews.title: Great, reliable keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this keyboard for over a year and it's still the best one I've ever had. It's so reliable and comfortable to type on. I use it for programming and also, of course, gaming. I hope this thing lasts forever!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew smith

customer_reviews.title: It's very high quality, feels amazing, extremely loud & large/heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard, it's expensive but the quality, performance, and millions of different, creative lighting possibilities are worth it. The only drawbacks besides price I personally experienced were it's massive size, heavy weight, and extreme volume due to the switches. If you plan on buying this keyboard be aware (with green switches) it does feel great and satisfying to press, but it's very loud, especially in Discord, Skype, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: the demo key that they have on the outside of the box is not like the actual keys
customer_reviews.text: Beware...the demo key that they have on the outside of the box is not like the actual keys. I was looking for something like Cherry MX Blue, so I got the razer green keys...and almost returned the product since the demo key outside of the box was not pushing like I wanted it to. I decided, though, to try it out and the keys on the actual keyboard are way different...just what I was looking for. Clicky, tactile keys. Thanks Amazon! I won't be returning this guy!
customer_reviews.author: R. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Finally, I can annoy everyone!
customer_reviews.text: I was getting so tired of typing and nobody noticing I was typing. Finally everybody can hear the click of my keys echoing for miles. If you use it to play games, make sure you have an open mic, you’ll surely make friends. I’m so popular now.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great keyboard! I wanted a clicky keyboard, and this delivered the sweet sounds I wanted to hear. The backlighting is also great, it's completely customizable with Razer Synapse, which you have to download from the internet. Each key can be a different color with a different effect. The backlighting can also be turned off, or dimmed. The wrist pad is removable and has magnets in both the keyboard and the wrist pad to connect / disconnect them. I also like the thing of having the extra set of hotkeys on the left side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I’ve tried yellow switches and I and IMPRESSED. I love the sound and I love the feeling. Perfect for anyone who talks to people while gaming or streams.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Malone

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect board for me as a gamer and a programmer. The macro keys are very helpful, as is the ergonomic wrist wrest for continuous typing. The customization options are excellent with the new Razer Synapse 3.0. The orange keys are still clicky, but they're a little muffled so it's not as loud as the green keys. Perfection!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Very easy/comfortable to use
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and the keyboard I had had cut key caps with letters gone. Keys are spread apart nicely and very comfortable to use. This is a huge upgrade and hope it outlasts my last keyboard. Who knows, i’m prepared for gaming too! Maybe i’ll Try it out. (:
customer_reviews.author: -D'

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic keyboard. The "clicky" keys are great for gaming ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic keyboard. The "clicky" keys are great for gaming and the buttons are quite responsive. Once in awhile there is an issue where the keyboard goes dark and the computer must be restarted to start glowing again. There are great preset options for the colors and it so easily customizable. Games like Overwatch automatically set to helpful configurations to ease gameplay. I would definitely buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Sirof

customer_reviews.title: LEDs are going out after a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is great. I've had this keyboard for a year and a half but now the LEDs are going out on my F1, 2, 3, w, e, s, d, z, and alt keys. I've tried changing the lighting in the chroma section but they will not change. Too bad I am just outside my warranty date. I have all Razer components but I think I'll be going to another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ray A.

customer_reviews.title: Most frivolously beautiful toy I've bought in years
customer_reviews.text: Most frivolously beautiful toy I've bought in years. Love this keyboard. Typing is a bit noisy (for those seeking applications more work or studio friendly, opt for the quieter key-switches!!) with the green switches, but the overall functionality and ease-of-use makes this an incredibly worth-while investment for gamers in particular. The synapse software is easy to use and creating unique and attractive light settings is quite fun. I personally enjoy the 'fire' setting with the Macro and Function keys on 'wave' and WASD on static white. : )
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great RGB Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It's my first RGB keyboard but so far it's working great. The keyboard with orange switches can still be heard through a microphone when I play with friends but it's significantly quieter than my friends Razer non-quiet keyboard. Overall I'd recommend this, especially if it's cheaper than the competitors (like when I got it). Plus the hand rest is removable and snaps in with magnets which is pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a game player, but this clicky keyboard reminds me of the good old days when you could tell if you made a mistake. Wouldn't have any different kind. Also helpful to program optional keys for different purposes for shortcuts, etc. Making different sections of the keyboard different colors is a boon.
customer_reviews.author: CherokeeSmiles

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard. Very worth it the price
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard and great quality. I’ve been using this keyboard for a year now and everything still works perfectly. The lights all work great and the keys work great too. Love it
customer_reviews.author: andy

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a week and it took me 3 days to get used to this "Macro" feature, it was very simple it just needed some attention. I use my macro buttons for Spotify as well. I also like the green switch features which are the " tactile and clicky" feature. I like the RGB selections and I also like the Community Workshop, I would recommend this keyboard 100% and it's worth it for the price. I also would like to thank razer for the wrist thing it helped me a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed

customer_reviews.title: Little pricey but great gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: While on the pricey side this is one of the best gaming keyboards I have ever used.. I got the orange key set they are quiet and smooth. The back-lighting is not obnoxious and the keys are individually lit for gaming ease. this is the second Chroma I have owned and I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Biggica

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: stopped working after a while ...choose some other keyboard its very unreliable
customer_reviews.author: sheikh farid

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have the original version of this keyboard and love it. My girlfriend is a writer and really liked the typewriter like feel and sound of the keyboard. I bought her the new V2 for her birthday and she loves it. Very responsive and have not had any problems with either keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Clicking is ASMR as F***
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard, everything is as described. Has a 3.5mm audio and usb 2.0 pass through. Using the chroma program I can change the lighting and suit my aesthetic! The wrist rest is comfortable to help with long gaming or just typing. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Remy L.

customer_reviews.title: Best Razer Keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard a month ago to replace my Ornata Chroma from razer and it is the best keyboard I’ve had. I’ve bought keyboards from 5 different brands and this is stunning. The wrist rest is very nice and pillowy soft. The RGB is very customizable and simple to use. The USB on the side is very helpful, I use it to connect my Astro A50’s and it works perfectly. I got the Razer Green switches, because I love the clicky sound, and they hold up really well, They feel like how a mechanical keyboard should be made. Overall 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Louder than expected. Still great!
customer_reviews.text: My wrists still ache from time to time, but I love the look, and effects. The macro keys are good for configuring Windows functions and opening programs with one tap.
customer_reviews.author: AlexCascadia

customer_reviews.title: but feel good to press and feels great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Wife loves this keyboard, she loves the feel of the mechanical keys; THE KEYS ARE VERY LOUD. but feel good to press and feels great for gaming. not knocking off a star for this as this was very much expected but didnt buy this for the silence
customer_reviews.author: Neage

customer_reviews.title: Love the keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Love the keyboard. The yellow switches are not to loud but they are a little to sensitive. You cant rest any weight from your hand on them or they are activated. My keys are set to light up when pressed so its easy to see how little presure is needed. It is very easy to bump a key and have it activate. Would not recommend the yellow switches if you don't want extreme sensitivity. I'd probably go a differet route.
customer_reviews.author: RisenDay

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, but key quality/durability is a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it twice. First time, the D key was completely broken. It would register once in three key presses. So I asked for a replacement. Got something that worked for about a month, then the M key started repeating itself when pressed. Had to tweak the OS to ignore repeats. Overall, it's a very nice product, well designed, the feel is great, but the quality of the keys is kind of a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Srecko

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard it’s functionaly and asthetically the best keyboard I’ve ever purchased and I always try to get the nicest stuff disregarding price usually
customer_reviews.author: seth

customer_reviews.title: Great Mechanical Gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Enjoying it so far. I got the warehouse deal and came in great condition so I'm happy. It does type loud but thats cause its a mechanical keyboard. Much better then my previous cheap keyboard when playing games.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Blahnik

customer_reviews.title: You = buy now
customer_reviews.text: I'm so damn, in love, with this keyboard!!! In my......17 years of pc gaming this is best keyboard ever! Great response, easy to type with but best of all is this wristguard good lord.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent keyboard for those who are willing  to fork out a bit more cash
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard a few months ago and it's a fantastic piece of equipment. The Razer Green switches have the nice clicky feel you would want while still being comfortable to type on. The lighting for the keys is far better than most keyboards I've seen and used and it's very easy to customize how you use the keyboard with razer synapse. My only complaints are that there is not a key puller included and the price is a little higher than what I was looking for but in this products case you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Great wrist rest, great font, great typing and very sleek.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this keyboard for a month or two and it is amazing. It is so nice to type on the Razer Green switches I selected and the RGB is super saturated and well lit. The wrist rest is also quite nice and feels almost like a pillow. I love the design of it, it is slightly slanted towards you and it is sleek. Another thing about the wrist rest is that it's magnetic, so if you don't like it you can take it off though I don't think anyone in their right mind would because of how soft it is
customer_reviews.author: Sebass

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard, got it in very good condition, appeared flawless out of the box...very happy with the purchase! Love the quiet keys, they can still be a little loud if you really hammer on them, but so much quieter than the 'clicky' keys.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I love the feel of the keys. I thought I ordered the one that didn't make as much noise when the key's were pressed. It's not anything negative about the keyboard. I guess I misread what color of switched I wanted. Still, this is an awesome keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Orange all the way!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Hated other mechanicals but the orange switches are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Rvzz Crory

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: This is a great keyboard and has great and satisfying clicking sounds. I have seen no better performance from any other keyboard and I buy a lot of keyboards (take my word for it) this keyboard clearly has no parallel. The LED lights are fully customizable and are extremely advanced, they can go from a range of any colors and can be adjusted in brightness. The macro keys are flawless and overall I have not had any complaints about the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: seoulbro

customer_reviews.title: Buy it now, Thank Me later
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard. It is super tactile and clicky and so satisfying to type on. I love everything about this keyboard and the RGB lighting is super nice. Well constructed and solid feeling. Super classy keyboard with no ugly gamer font on the keys. Love it. Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Wish I got the Orange instead of Yellow switches
customer_reviews.text: I got the yellow switches and to be honest I don't really like the feel of them. Like there's nothing behind them. The keyboard looks badass though and the wrist rest is just premium quality. But I wish I had gone with the orange or green switches.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Razer Chroma software is pretty terrible unfortunately but the hardware of this keyboard is ...
customer_reviews.text: Razer Chroma software is pretty terrible unfortunately but the hardware of this keyboard is very well done. The keys are extremely clicky and satisfying. Gaming on this keyboard is perfect and the Chroma lights (when working) are always a crowd pleaser
customer_reviews.author: Teknolg

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming keyboard
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this keyboard. He loves the usb and headphone pass through and the overall feel and function of it. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sonny

customer_reviews.title: Really nice keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great keyboard! Really clicky and feels great to type on, and the Chroma lights look so nice and the wrist wrest is very soft and comfortable. This is a premium product, but it does have a premium price tag as well, and I think that this keyboard is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: BEST KEYBOARD!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased from the Philippines and let them shipped it to my friend in Carson Los Angeles. with that said it arrived like 3 days, it was faster than I thought. as she unbox the package everything was fine. good packaging no issues or whatever. I'd Recommend this keyboard for people like me who plays dota 2 or csgo or any other game. the chroma synapse app works great with games and this keyboard. I also recommend buying deathadder elite or mamba with goaliathus extended chroma for perfect combination. 2 thumbs up
customer_reviews.author: @kylefigueroa11

customer_reviews.title: I love Razer.
customer_reviews.text: And I love this keyboard. Mechanical click, high quality, warranty, RGB LED lights. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

product_meta.title: Razer BlackWidow Chroma V2: Esports Gaming Keyboard - Ergonomic Wrist Rest - 5 Dedicated Macro Keys - Razer Green Mechanical Switches (Tactile and Clicky)
product_meta.description:
Color:Green Switch

Frequently Asked Questions

What is Chroma Lighting and where can I find out more about it? Chroma by Razer represents more than just multicolor, it opens up limitless personalization options. Whether it’s your favorite shade of green or your guild colors, Chroma gives you the freedom to decide. It could be one, three or even thirty-seven colors, with a spectrum of visual effects featuring 16.8 million colors; the possibilities are whatever you can imagine. 

If I have other Chroma enabled devices, can I sync the lighting effects with my Blackwidow Chroma? Yes, you can. All Chroma enabled devices are equipped with inter-device color synchronization. With just one click of a button via Razer Synapse, your Razer Chroma enabled devices’ lighting effects will by synchronized. Note that the lighting effect you would like to sync has to be supported by both Razer Chroma devices individually.

Do I need software drivers to use the Razer BlackWidow Chroma? You may use the standard keyboard functions by simply plugging the Razer BlackWidow Chroma to any available USB port on your computer. However you will need to download the software and drivers in order to enable advanced features such as macro recording and profile settings.

Does the Razer BlackWidow Chroma have anti-ghosting capability? How about N-key rollover? Yes, the Razer BlackWidow Chroma features a gaming optimized key matrix that allows the recognition of up to six simultaneous key presses. N-key rollover (NKRO) only works with a direct connection to a native PS/2 port on the computer which provides for other limitations that USB overcomes. The Razer BlackWidow Chroma’s gaming optimized key matrix serves a similar purpose while using an ordinary USB port.

What are the 5 extra gaming buttons used for? These are dedicated keys on the keyboard specifically designed to bind macros to or to reprogram into specific functions required by the user. Macros enable a user to program one button on a peripheral to perform a string of timed commands, whenever the button is pressed.

Will my Razer USB PC product work on a console (XB1 , PS4, etc)? It has USB ports. Our PC USB products are meant for PC use only and we do not support using them on a PlayStation 4 or XBox One console.
feature_bullets: MULTI-AWARD WINNING RAZER MECHANICAL SWITCHES: Designed specifically for gaming. Durable up to 80 million keystrokes
INDIVIDUALLY BACKLIT KEYS: Powered by Razer Chroma with 16.8 million customizable color options
ERGONOMIC WRIST REST: Ensure long hours of comfortable gaming
10 KEY ANTI-GHOSTING: Execute up to ten commands at the same time
5 DEDICATED MACRO KEYS: With Audio and USB pass-through

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,014 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
